item.name: Abacus
item.description: A simple device useful for mathematics

item.name: Acid (Vial)
item.description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged Attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an Improvised Weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

item.name: Alchemist's Fire (Flask)
item.description: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged Attack against a creature or object, treating the Alchemist's Fire as an Improvised Weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

item.name: Arrows (20)
item.description: N/A

item.name: Blowgun Needles (50)
item.description: N/A

item.name: Crossbow Bolts (20)
item.description: N/A

item.name: Sling Bullets (20)
item.description: N/A

item.name: Antitoxin (Vial)
item.description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on Saving Throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to Undead or constructs.

item.name: Crystal (Arcane Focus)
item.description: An arcane focus is a s⁠pecial item—an orb, a Crystal, a rod, a specially constructed staff, a wand-like length of wood, or some similar item—designed to channel the power of arcane Spells. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.

item.name: Orb (Arcane Focus)
item.description: An arcane focus is a s⁠pecial item—an orb, a Crystal, a rod, a specially constructed staff, a wand-like length of wood, or some similar item—designed to channel the power of arcane Spells. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.

item.name: Rod (Arcane Focus)
item.description: An arcane focus is a s⁠pecial item—an orb, a Crystal, a rod, a specially constructed staff, a wand-like length of wood, or some similar item—designed to channel the power of arcane Spells. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.

item.name: Staff (Arcane Focus)
item.description: An arcane focus is a s⁠pecial item—an orb, a Crystal, a rod, a specially constructed staff, a wand-like length of wood, or some similar item—designed to channel the power of arcane Spells. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.

item.name: Wand (Arcane Focus)
item.description: An arcane focus is a s⁠pecial item—an orb, a Crystal, a rod, a specially constructed staff, a wand-like length of wood, or some similar item—designed to channel the power of arcane Spells. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.

item.name: Backpack
item.description: It holds things.

item.name: Ball Bearings (Bag of 1000)
item.description: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn’t need to make the save.

item.name: Barrel
item.description: For when you need to hold more things than a backpack?

item.name: Basket
item.description: For when you need to hold less things than a backpack?

item.name: Bedroll
item.description: It's better than sleeping on the ground...

item.name: Bell
item.description: It dings when you shake it

item.name: Blanket
item.description: Makes your bed more comfortable.

item.name: Block and Tackle
item.description: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to Objects, a Block and tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

item.name: Book
item.description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on Gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of Spells is a Spellbook (described later in this section).

item.name: Bottle (Glass)
item.description: It holds 8 Ounces of Liquid

item.name: Bucket
item.description: Mop not included

item.name: Caltrops (Bag of 20)
item.description: As an action, you can spread a bag of Caltrops to cover a square area that is 5 feet on a side. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. Taking this damage reduces the creature’s walking speed by 10 feet until the creature regains at least 1 hit point. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn’t need to make the save.

item.name: Candle
item.description: For 1 hour, a Candle sheds bright li⁠g⁠ht in a 5-foot radius and dim li⁠g⁠ht for an additional 5 feet.

item.name: Case (Crossbow Bolts)
item.description: This wooden case can hold up to twenty Crossbow bolts.

item.name: Case (Map or Scroll)
item.description: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of Parchment.

item.name: Chain (10 Feet)
item.description: A chain has 10 Hit Points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

item.name: Chalk (One Piece)
item.description: Poor mans invisibility defense

item.name: Chest
item.description: A somewhat secure container to store your belongings in. Lock not included

item.name: Climber's Kit
item.description: A climber’s kit includes spec⁠ial pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use the climber’s kit as an action to anchor yourself; when you do, you can’t fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself, and you can’t climb more than 25 feet away from that point without undoing the anchor.

item.name: Clothes (Common)
item.description: When you just need a pair of trousers

item.name: Clothes (Costume)
item.description: For when you need to become that Jester you always wanted to be

item.name: Clothes (Fine)
item.description: Did royalty actually part with this?

item.name: Clothes (Traveler's)
item.description: There's got to be a hood included with this set of clothes

item.name: Component Pouch
item.description: A Component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material Components and other spe⁠cial items you need to cast your Spells, except for those Components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

item.name: Crowbar
item.description: Using a Crowbar grants advantage to Strength Checks where the crowbar’s leverage can be applied.

item.name: Sprig of Mistletoe (Druidic Focus)
item.description: A Druidic focus might be a Sprig of mistletoe or holly, a wand or scepter made of yew or another sp⁠ecial wood, a staff drawn whole out of a living tree, or a totem object incorporating feathers, fur, bones, and teeth from sacred animals. A druid can use such an object as a Spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.

item.name: Totem (Druidic Focus)
item.description: A Druidic focus might be a Sprig of mistletoe or holly, a wand or scepter made of yew or another sp⁠ecial wood, a staff drawn whole out of a living tree, or a totem object incorporating feathers, fur, bones, and teeth from sacred animals. A druid can use such an object as a Spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.

item.name: Wooden Staff (Druidic Focus)
item.description: A Druidic focus might be a Sprig of mistletoe or holly, a wand or scepter made of yew or another sp⁠ecial wood, a staff drawn whole out of a living tree, or a totem object incorporating feathers, fur, bones, and teeth from sacred animals. A druid can use such an object as a Spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10.

item.name: Fishing Tackle
item.description: This kit includes a wooden rod, silken line, corkwood bobbers, steel hooks, lead sinkers, velvet lures, and narrow netting.

item.name: Flask
item.description: The taproom always seems to be running low on these

item.name: Tankard
item.description: Never in stock... try a flask?

item.name: Grappling Hook
item.description: It's a hook?

item.name: Hammer
item.description: Small hammer, for when you need to make a house

item.name: Hammer (Sledge)
item.description: For when you want to leave a dent

item.name: Healer's Kit
item.description: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 Hit Points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

item.name: Amulet (Holy Symbol)
item.description: A holy sym⁠bol is a representation of a god or pantheon. It might be an Amulet depicting a symb⁠ol representing a deity, the same sym⁠bol carefully engraved or inlaid as an Emblem on a Shield, or a tiny box holding a fragment of a sacred relic. Appendix B lists the sym⁠bols commonly associated with many gods in the multiverse. A Cleric or Paladin can use a holy sym⁠bol as a Spellcasting focus, as described in Casting a Spell. To use the sym⁠bol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a Shield.

item.name: Emblem(Holy Symbol)
item.description: A holy sym⁠bol is a representation of a god or pantheon. It might be an Amulet depicting a symb⁠ol representing a deity, the same sym⁠bol carefully engraved or inlaid as an Emblem on a Shield, or a tiny box holding a fragment of a sacred relic. Appendix B lists the sym⁠bols commonly associated with many gods in the multiverse. A Cleric or Paladin can use a holy sym⁠bol as a Spellcasting focus, as described in Casting a Spell. To use the sym⁠bol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a Shield.

item.name: Reliquary (Holy Symbol)
item.description: A holy sym⁠bol is a representation of a god or pantheon. It might be an Amulet depicting a symb⁠ol representing a deity, the same sym⁠bol carefully engraved or inlaid as an Emblem on a Shield, or a tiny box holding a fragment of a sacred relic. Appendix B lists the sym⁠bols commonly associated with many gods in the multiverse. A Cleric or Paladin can use a holy sym⁠bol as a Spellcasting focus, as described in Casting a Spell. To use the sym⁠bol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a Shield.

item.name: Holy Water (Flask)
item.description:
As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged Attack against a target creature, treating the Holy Water as an Improvised Weapon. If the target is a fiend or Undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage.

A Cleric or Paladin may create Holy Water by performing a spec⁠ial ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

item.name: Hourglass
item.description: It helps track a simple hour of time. Useful to know when your short rest is up

item.name: Hunting Trap
item.description: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its Movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

item.name: Ink (1 Ounce Bottle)
item.description: Comes in black, blue, and red varieties

item.name: Ink Pen
item.description: For when a feather just doesn't cut it

item.name: Jug
item.description: Normally filled with Wine or Water

item.name: Pitcher
item.description: Mead maybe goes in this one?

item.name: Ladder (10-foot)
item.description: Because finding another route isn't worth it

item.name: Lamp
item.description: A lamp casts bright ligh⁠⁠t in a 15-foot radius and dim li⁠g⁠ht for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

item.name: Lantern (Bullseye)
item.description: A Bullseye lantern casts bright lig⁠⁠ht in a 60-foot cone and dim lig⁠ht for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

item.name: Lantern (Hooded)
item.description: A Hooded lantern casts bright lig⁠ht in a 30-foot radius and dim lig⁠ht for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the lig⁠ht to dim lig⁠ht in a 5-foot radius.

item.name: Lock (Basic)
item.description: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves’ tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check.

item.name: Magnifying Glass
item.description: This lens allows a closer look at small Objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a Magnifying glass requires lig⁠ht as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite. A Magnifying glass grants advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect an item that is small or highly detailed.

item.name: Manacles
item.description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the Manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of Manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves’ tools can pick the manacles’ lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 Hit Points.

item.name: Mess Kit
item.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

item.name: Mirror (Steel)
item.description: Because Glass mirrors haven't been invented yet

item.name: Oil (Flask)
item.description: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged Attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an Improvised Weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

item.name: Paper (One Sheet)
item.description: For taking notes

item.name: Parchment (One Sheet)
item.description: When paper is too costly

item.name: Perfume (Vial)
item.description: It kinda smells nice...

item.name: Pick Miner's
item.description: We're off to work we go...

item.name: Piton
item.description: Useful to jam into rocks or a hillside

item.name: Poison (Basic - Vial)
item.description: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of Ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the Poisoned weapon or Ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

item.name: Pole (10 Foot)
item.description: Poke. Poke. Poke... pit fall trap

item.name: Pot (Iron)
item.description: Useful to cook with, also makes a blunt weapon

item.name: Potion of Healing (Lesser)
item.description: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4 + 2 Hit Points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

item.name: Pouch
item.description: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 Sling bullets or 50 Blowgun Needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell Components is called a Component pouch (described earlier in this section).

item.name: Quiver
item.description: A Quiver can hold up to 20 Arrows.

item.name: Ram (Portable)
item.description: You can use a Portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

item.name: Rations
item.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

item.name: Rope (Hempen) [50 Feet]
item.description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 Hit Points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

item.name: Rope (Silk) [50 Feet]
item.description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 Hit Points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

item.name: Sack
item.description: Not as easy to carry as a backpack

item.name: Merchant's Scale
item.description: A scale includes a small balance, pans, and a suitable assortment of weights up to 2 pounds. With it, you can measure the exact weight of small Objects, such as raw precious metals or Trade Goods, to help determine their worth.

item.name: Sealing Wax
item.description: Useful to assume a letter wasn't opened, unless of course someone knows mending

item.name: Shovel
item.description: Better to dig a grave with than bear hands

item.name: Signal Whistle
item.description: It makes a high pitched noise

item.name: Signet Ring
item.description: A ring useful for nobility to identify themselves with

item.name: Soap
item.description: To keep clean with

item.name: Spellbook
item.description: Essential for wizards, a Spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording Spells.

item.name: Spikes (Iron) [10]
item.description: They are pointy

item.name: Spyglass
item.description: Objects viewed through a Spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

item.name: Tinderbox
item.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in lig⁠ht oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to lig⁠ht a torch—or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel—takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

item.name: Torch
item.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright lig⁠ht in a 20-foot radius and dim lig⁠ht for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee Attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

item.name: Vial
item.description: An empty container which holds 6 oz. of liquids

item.name: Waterskin
item.description: Holds a pint of water

item.name: Alchemist's Supplies
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Brewer's Supplies
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Carpenter's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Cobbler's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Cook's Utensils
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Glassblower's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Jeweler's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Leatherworker's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Mason's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Painter's Supplies
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Potter's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Smith's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Tinker's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Weaver's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

item.name: Disguise Kit
item.description: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a visual disguise

item.name: Forgery Kit
item.description: This small box contains a variety of papers and parchments, pens and inks, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and other supplies necessary to create convincing forgeries of physical documents. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a physical forgery of a document

item.name: Dragonchess set
item.description: If you are proficient with a given gaming set you can add your proficiency bonus to play the game.

item.name: Dice Set
item.description: If you are proficient with a given gaming set you can add your proficiency bonus to play the game.

item.name: Playing Card Set
item.description: If you are proficient with a given gaming set you can add your proficiency bonus to play the game.

item.name: Three-Dragon Ante Set
item.description: If you are proficient with a given gaming set you can add your proficiency bonus to play the game.

item.name: Herbalism Kit
item.description: This kit contains a variety of instruments sech as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and potions of healing

item.name: Bagpipes
item.description: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your poficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10. Each type of musical instrument requires a  separate proficiency

item.name: Dulcimer
item.description: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your poficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10. Each type of musical instrument requires a  separate proficiency

item.name: Flute
item.description: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your poficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10. Each type of musical instrument requires a  separate proficiency

item.name: Lute
item.description: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your poficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10. Each type of musical instrument requires a  separate proficiency

item.name: Horn
item.description: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your poficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10. Each type of musical instrument requires a  separate proficiency

item.name: Pan Flute
item.description: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your poficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10. Each type of musical instrument requires a  separate proficiency

item.name: Shawm
item.description: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your poficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10. Each type of musical instrument requires a  separate proficiency

item.name: Viol
item.description: Several of the most common types of musical instruments are shown on the table as examples. If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your poficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, as described in chapter 10. Each type of musical instrument requires a  separate proficiency

item.name: Navigator's Tools
item.description: This set of instruments is used for navigation at sea. Proficiency with navigator's tools lets you chart a ship's course and follow navigation charts. In addition, these tools allow you to add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to avoid getting lost at sea

item.name: Poisoner's kit
item.description: A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit let's you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons

item.name: Cartographer's Tools
item.description: These Special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your Proficiency Bonus to any Ability Checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.
